pullRequest.title: Use reentrant executor in CachingHiveMetastoreModule
pullRequest.bodyText:
Loading of cache entry in CachingHiveMetastoreModule
might trigger loading of another cache entry for different
object type. In case there are no empty executor slots,
such operation would deadlock. Therefore, a reentrant
executor needs to be used that would trigger loading
action directly if it is triggered from executor thread
context.
Fixes: #2962

nodes.bodyText:
Previously the call would run on a separate thread. Now it runs on the stack.
It would be better to extended BoundedExecutor, or alternatively, share the underlying executor and delegate to that.

It's tri-state effectively (true, false, but could be unset).
You can make it two-state by using Object MARKER and only set, remove methods.

+package io.prestosql.plugin.hive.metastore.cache;
+
+import java.util.concurrent.Executor;
+
+import static java.util.Objects.requireNonNull;
+
+public class ReentrantExecutor
+        implements Executor
+{
+    private final ThreadLocal<Boolean> executorThreadMarkers = ThreadLocal.withInitial(() -> false);

nodes.bodyText:
Remove the else block.
If you really want reset state, use no initial value (and Object, not Boolean).
If you want to use Boolean, then initial value is appropriate and you shouldn't reset false to unset.

commit.message:
Use reentrant executor in CachingHiveMetastoreModule

Loading of cache entry in CachingHiveMetastoreModule
might trigger loading of another cache entry for different
object type. In case there are no empty executor slots,
such operation would deadlock. Therefore, a reentrant
executor needs to be used that would trigger loading
action directly if it is triggered from executor thread
context.

Loading of cache entry in CachingHiveMetastoreModule
might trigger loading of another cache entry for different
object type. In case there are no empty executor slots,
such operation would deadlock. Therefore, a reentrant
executor needs to be used that would trigger loading
action directly if it is triggered from executor thread
context.
